qas.question: What became an issue for the working child?
Was illiteracy a factor in changing the minds of parents of child labourers?

answers.text: many parents developed a change of opinion

qas.question: What are the reasons that lead to a decline of child labour?

answers.text: financial changes in the economy, changes in the development of technology, raised wages, and continuous regulations on factory legislation

context: With such a high percentage of children working, the rising of <a0_0>illiteracy<a0_0/>, and the lack of a formal education became a widespread issue for many children who worked to provide for their families. Due to this problematic trend, <a1_0>many parents developed a change of opinion<a1_0/> when deciding whether or not to send their children to work. Other factors that lead to the decline of child labour included <a2_0>financial changes in the economy, changes in the development of technology, raised wages, and continuous regulations on factory legislation<a2_0/>.
